class_notes: In IDS 205W we will examine memory from a diversity of disciplinary angles' among them the biological, psychological, and literary as a lens into these questions: Why do we believe what we do? And what role does science play in this? What is the nature of scientific evidence? How does it compare to other types of evidence? What counts as evidence in science? In other disciplines? What are the histories of the answers to these questions? And how do they affect our everyday lives? Co-requisite: ENGRD 223
course_description: IDS205 addresses: What is the nature of scientific evidence? How does it compare to other types of evidence? What counts as evidence in science? In other disciplines? What are the histories of the answers to these questions? How do they affect our everyday lives? Co-requisite: ENGRD 223
prerequisites: ENGRD 223 or equivalent transfer credit as co-requisite.
